t: Even*p to day is my complaint bitter: my stroke is heavier than my groaning.
Oh*p that I knew where I might find him! that I might come even to his seat!
I*p would order my cause before him, and fill my mouth with arguments.
I*p would know the words which he would answer me, and understand what he would say unto me.
Will*p he plead against me with his great power? No; but he would put strength in me.
There*p the righteous might dispute with him; so should I be delivered for ever from my judge.
Behold,*p I go forward, but he is not there; and backward, but I cannot perceive him:
On*p the left hand, where he doth work, but I cannot behold him: he hideth himself on the right hand, that I cannot see him:
But*p he knoweth the way that I take: when he hath tried me, I shall come forth as gold.
My*p foot hath held his steps, his way have I kept, and not declined.
Neither*p have I gone back from the commandment of his lips; I have esteemed the words of his mouth more than my necessary food.
But*p he is in one mind, and who can turn him? and what his soul desireth, even that he doeth.
For*p he performeth the thing that is appointed for me: and many such things are with him.
Therefore*p am I troubled at his presence: when I consider, I am afraid of him.
For*p God maketh my heart soft, and the Almighty troubleth me:
Because*p I was not cut off before the darkness, neither hath he covered the darkness from my face.
